member.summary: Gets the unique ID for this channel.
member.remarks: This value is usually shared for an anonymous channel so the remote party can accept it with or reject it with .

member.summary: Gets the mechanism used for tracing activity related to this channel.

member.name: P:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.Channel.Acceptance
member.summary: Gets a that completes when the channel is accepted, rejected, or canceled.
member.remarks: If the channel is accepted, this task transitions to state. If the channel offer is canceled, this task transitions to a state. If the channel offer is rejected, this task transitions to a state.

member.name: P:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.Channel.Completion
member.summary: Gets a that completes when the channel is disposed, which occurs when is invoked or when both sides have indicated they are done writing to the channel.

member.name: P:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.Channel.ReceivedMessagePipeWriter
member.summary: Gets the pipe writer to use when a message is received for this channel, so that the channel owner will notice and read it.

member.summary: Closes this channel and releases all resources associated with it.

member.summary: Accepts an offer made by the remote party.

member.returns: A value indicating whether the offer was accepted. It may fail if the channel was already closed or the offer rescinded.

member.summary: Occurs when the remote party has accepted our offer of this channel.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the acceptance went through; false if the channel is already accepted, rejected or offer rescinded.

member.summary: A channel is proposed to the remote party.

member.summary: A channel proposal has been accepted.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.ControlCode.Content
member.summary: The payload of the frame is a payload intended for channel consumption.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.ControlCode.ContentWritingCompleted
member.summary: Sent after all bytes have been transmitted on a given channel. Either or both sides may send this. A channel may be automatically closed when each side has both transmitted and received this message.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.ControlCode.ChannelTerminated
member.summary: Sent when a channel is closed, an incoming offer is rejected, or an outgoing offer is canceled.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.ControlChannelId
member.summary: The channel id reserved for control frames.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.ProtocolMagicNumber
member.summary: The magic number to send at the start of communication.
member.remarks: If the protocol ever changes, change this random number. It serves both as a way to recognize the other end actually supports multiplexing and ensure compatibility.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.ControlFrameEncoding
member.summary: The encoding used for characters in control frames.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.DefaultChannelOptions
member.summary: The options to use for channels we create in response to incoming offers.
member.remarks: Whatever these settings are, they can be replaced when the channel is accepted.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.framePayloadMaxLength
member.summary: The maximum length of a frame's payload.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.isOdd
member.summary: A value indicating whether this is the "odd" party in the conversation (where the other one would be "even").
member.remarks: This value is only significant for parts of the protocol where it's useful to have the two parties behave slightly differently to avoid conflicts.

member.name: M:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.CreateChannel(Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.ChannelOptions)
member.summary: Creates an anonymous channel that may be accepted by . Its existance must be communicated by other means (typically another, existing channel) to encourage acceptance.
member.param: A set of options that describe local treatment of this channel.
member.remarks: Note that while the channel is created immediately, any local write to that channel will be buffered locally until the remote party accepts the channel.

member.name: M:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.AcceptChannel(System.Int32,Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.ChannelOptions)
member.summary: Accepts a channel with a specific ID.
member.param: The of the channel to accept.
A set of options that describe local treatment of this channel.
member.exception: Thrown if the channel is already accepted or is no longer offered by the remote party.
member.remarks: This method can be used to accept anonymous channels created with . Unlike which will await for a channel offer if a matching one has not been made yet, this method only accepts an offer for a channel that has already been made.

member.name: M:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.RejectChannel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Rejects an offer for the channel with a specified ID.
member.param: The ID of the channel whose offer should be rejected.
member.exception: Thrown if the channel was already accepted.

member.name: M:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.OfferChannelAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Offers a new, named channel to the remote party so they may accept it with .
member.param: A name for the channel, which must be accepted on the remote end to complete creation. It need not be unique, and may be empty but must not be null. Any characters are allowed, and max length is determined by the maximum frame payload (based on UTF-8 encoding).
A cancellation token.
member.returns: A task that completes with the if the offer is accepted on the remote end or faults with if the remote end rejects the channel.
member.exception: Thrown if is canceled before the channel is accepted by the remote end.

member.name: M:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.OfferChannelAsync(System.String,Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.ChannelOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Offers a new, named channel to the remote party so they may accept it with .
member.param: A name for the channel, which must be accepted on the remote end to complete creation. It need not be unique, and may be empty but must not be null. Any characters are allowed, and max length is determined by the maximum frame payload (based on UTF-8 encoding).
A set of options that describe local treatment of this channel.
A cancellation token.
member.returns: A task that completes with the if the offer is accepted on the remote end or faults with if the remote end rejects the channel.
member.exception: Thrown if is canceled before the channel is accepted by the remote end.

member.name: M:Nerdbank.Streams.MultiplexingStream.AcceptChannelAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Accepts a channel that the remote end has attempted or may attempt to create.
member.param: The name of the channel to accept.
A token to indicate lost interest in accepting the channel.
member.returns: The , after its offer has been received from the remote party and accepted.
member.remarks: If multiple offers exist with the specified , the first one received will be accepted.
member.exception: Thrown if is canceled before a request to create the channel has been received.

A token to indicate lost interest in accepting the channel.
member.returns: The , after its offer has been received from the remote party and accepted.

Thrown if is canceled before a request to create the channel has been received.

true to throw if 0 bytes are read before the stream before the end of stream is encountered; false to simply return false when that happens.
A cancellation token.

member.summary: Enables efficiently reading a stream using .

A hint at the size of messages that are commonly transferred. Use 0 for a commonly reasonable default.

member.name: M:Nerdbank.Streams.PipeExtensions.UseStrictPipeReader(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a that reads from the specified exactly as told to do so.
member.param: The stream to read from using a pipe.
A hint at the size of messages that are commonly transferred. Use 0 for a commonly reasonable default.
member.remarks: This reader may not be as efficient as the -based returned from , but its interaction with the underlying is closer to how a would typically be used which can ease migration from streams to pipes.

member.summary: An that reserves some fixed size for a header.
member.typeparam: The type of element written by this writer.
member.remarks: This type is used for inserting the length of list in the header when the length is not known beforehand. It is optimized to minimize or avoid copying.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.PrefixingBufferWriter`1.PayloadSizeGuess
member.summary: The value to use in place of when it is 0.
member.remarks: We choose ~4K, since 4K is the default size for buffers in a lot of corefx libraries. We choose 4K - 4 specifically because length prefixing is so often for an value, and if we ask for 1 byte more than 4K, memory pools tend to give us 8K.

member.summary: The underlying buffer writer.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.PrefixingBufferWriter`1.expectedPrefixSize
member.summary: The length of the prefix to reserve space for.

member.name: F:Nerdbank.Streams.PrefixingBufferWriter`1.payloadSizeHint
member.summary: The minimum space to reserve for the payload when first asked for a buffer.
member.remarks: This, added to , makes up the minimum size to request from to minimize the chance that we'll need to copy buffers from to .

member.summary: The pool to use when initializing .

member.summary: The buffer writer to use for all buffers after the original one obtained from .

member.name: M:Nerdbank.Streams.PrefixingBufferWriter`1.#ctor(System.Buffers.IBufferWriter{`0},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Buffers.MemoryPool{`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The underlying writer that should ultimately receive the prefix and payload.
The length of the header to reserve space for. Must be a positive number.
A hint at the expected max size of the payload. The real size may be more or less than this, but additional copying is avoided if it does not exceed this amount. If 0, a reasonable guess is made.
The memory pool to use for allocating additional memory when the payload exceeds .

member.name: M:Nerdbank.Streams.PrefixingBufferWriter`1.Commit
member.summary: Commits all the elements written and the prefix to the underlying writer and advances the underlying writer past the prefix and payload.
member.remarks: This instance is safe to reuse after this call.

member.name: P:Nerdbank.Streams.Sequence`1.MinimumSpanLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum length for any array allocated as a segment in the sequence. Any non-positive value allows the pool to determine the length of the array.

remarks.para: Each time or is called, previously allocated memory is used if it is large enough to satisfy the length demand. If new memory must be allocated, the argument to one of these methods typically dictate the length of array to allocate. When the caller uses very small values (just enough for its immediate need) but the high level scenario can predict that a large amount of memory will be ultimately required, it can be advisable to set this property to a value such that just a few larger arrays are allocated instead of many small ones.
The in use may itself have a minimum array length as well, in which case the higher of the two minimums dictate the minimum array size that will be allocated.
